div.sent: God is kind.
He is kind to human kind of the world because He has created them.
He loves everyone equally.
He is the Father of mankind.
From Him we have come.
So, He takes care of us.
He has created us in His own image.
We all are equal in the eyes of God.
He wants us to be equally kind to all.
The parable of the good Samaritan teaches us a good moral.
We also learn from it that God loves all equally.
One day a teacher of the Law asked Jesus, Who is my neighbour?
In reply to this question Jesus told him a story.
Once there was a man who was going to Jericho from Jerusalem .
Suddenly a band of robbers attacked him and snatched everything from him.
They beat him up and left him half dead.
It so happened that a priest was going down that road.
But when he saw the man, he walked away.
He washed his wounds and bandaged them.
Then he put the man on his own donkey and took him to an inn.
The next day he took out two silver coins and gave them to the innkeeper.
The teacher of the Law answered, The one who was kind to him.
Through this parable Jesus teaches us the following:
God loves and protects us in the same way as the good Samaritan did;
He who loves God, loves mankind to;
We can love God by loving our neighbours;
We can serve God by serving our neighbours;
All men irrespective of the caste and creed are our neighbours.
Sujan is nine years old.
On his way to school he used to see a lame boy begging.
The name of the boy was Shyamal.
One day Sujan said to Shyamal, How did you lose your leg?
Shyamal answered, In a bus accident I lost one of my legs.
At this Sujan's heart was filled with pity.
He thought how he could help Shyamal.
One day he was delighted to read a news item in a newspaper.
They would give voluntary services by fixing artificial legs to patients who lost their legs.
Sujan thought that he could help Shyamal.
He told Shyamal's parents about it.
They agreed to Sujan's proposal for their son's treatment.
Sujan took Shyamal to the doctors.
They gave him an artificial leg to walk all by himself.
Now Shyamal begs no more.
There is a night school near his house.
Those who work by day can read in this school at night.
Shyamal now reads in this school and works in a grocer's shop during the daytime.
We too can help others in this way.
We can be kind to the poor and the helpless and take care of them.
We can be kind like our kind Father by being kind to others.
We should come forward to help the needy and the distressed.
We should serve God by serving mankind.
Make a list of the kind deeds of the good Samaritan.
Write down in your exercise book some deeds of kindness that you can do.
